intro: Appendicula undulata, commonly known as the undulating appendicula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, often in alpine environments. Its flowering period occurs during the warmer months, and it is known for its ability to thrive in harsh, high-altitude conditions. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
